misconceptions.inferred_category_name: No misconception detected (correct loop nesting for pattern printing)
misconceptions.student_thought_process: The student believes that printing a right triangle requires an outer loop for rows and an inner loop for columns, printing one '*' per inner-loop iteration, then printing a newline after each row.
misconceptions.conceptual_gap: There is no gap here: Java executes the nested loops exactly as intended, and placing println() after the inner loop correctly moves to the next line after each row is completed.
misconceptions.error_manifestation: None (produces the expected pattern for positive N).
